info.name: Qontak CRM OpenAPI
info.description: Qontak CRM Open API is a system that allows developers to connect or integrate multiple platforms. This means that this system allows developers to access certain internal functions of a program, then connect it with other programs. ## **Improve business efficiency with integrated products** Accelerate your business processes and development with systems that are perfectly integrated with each other. Improve practicality and cost savings. ## Flexible system to meet your business needs With interaction between systems, it will reduce human errors and facilitate the administrative process. Qontak has a flexible and easy open API system. Qontak will assist with every integration process Qontak CRM Open API is built to satisfy the needs of integration between Qontak clients and CRM in Qontak. By using the APIs, client can push the data to CRM server and also receive data from Qontak available endpoints. Manage leads, companies, deals, and tasks effectively and easily using the CRM API.

item.description:
With OAuth 2.0, you first retrieve an access token for the API, then use that token to authenticate future requests. Accessing data with OAuth 2.0 varies greatly between API service providers, but typically involves a few requests back and forth between client application, user, and API.

An example OAuth 2.0 flow could run as follows:

- A client application makes a request for the user to authorize access to their data.
- If the user grants access, the application then requests an access token from the service provider, passing the access grant from the user and authentication details to identify the client.
- The service provider validates these details and returns an access token.
- The client uses the access token to request the user data with the service provider.
    

**client_id**, **client_secret**, **code** and **redirect_uri** can be obtained by submitting grant request form. Use this link below to navigate to grant request page:

`https://app.qontak.com/oauth/applications/new`

note: make sure you are logged in to CRM Dashboards to be able to access the url above.

item.description: You can request token using your CRM credential (_email address & password_)

APIs use authorization to ensure that client requests access data securely. This can involve authenticating the sender of a request and confirming that they have permission to access or manipulate the relevant data. If you're building an API, you can choose from a variety of auth models. If you're integrating a third-party API, the required authorization will be specified by the API provider.

You can pass auth details along with any request you send in Postman. Auth data can be included in the header, body, or as parameters to a request. If you enter your auth details in the **Authorization** tab, Postman will automatically populate the relevant parts of the request for your chosen auth type. You can use variables and collections to define authorization details more safely and efficiently, enabling you to reuse the same information in multiple places.

Each API request requires authentication to identify the permission that is responsible for making the request. Authentication is provided by access tokens.

item.name: Contact

request.description:
Get Contacts Template Info. This request is to get all fields info on object Contact included additional fields. `"additional_field": false` = Default field `"additional_field": true` = Additional field. | **Name** | **Type** | **Mandatory** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | status | string | Mandatory | status code of an API Call | | type | string | Mandatory | type of the status code | | error_code | string | Mandatory | error_code of an API Call | | info | string | Mandatory | info of the status URL | | developer_message | string | Mandatory | message of the status code | | message | string | Mandatory | message of the status code | | timestamp | string | Mandatory | the timestamp format used to display date between start and between end.
example format;
[https://www.qontak.com/api/v3.1/contacts?created_between_start=24/05/2022&created_between_end=24/06/2022](https://www.qontak.com/api/v3.1/contacts?created_between_start=24/05/2022&created_between_end=24/06/2022) | | log_id | string | Mandatory | log_id of an API |

request.description:
This request is to get chat history on contact timeline by contact ID.

> Note: chat history can be get if your CRM account have integrated with Chat Panel.

request.description:
### Create a Task

This endpoint allows the user to create a new task.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string): The name of the task.
    
- `crm_person_id` (null): The ID of the CRM person associated with the task.
    
- `crm_person_full_name` (null): The full name of the CRM person associated with the task.
    
- `crm_deal_id` (null): The ID of the CRM deal associated with the task.
    
- `crm_deal_name` (null): The name of the CRM deal associated with the task.
    
- `crm_company_id` (null): The ID of the CRM company associated with the task.
    
- `crm_company_name` (null): The name of the CRM company associated with the task.
    
- `crm_task_status_id` (integer): The ID of the task status.
    
- `user_id` (integer): The ID of the user associated with the task.
    
- `user_full_name` (null): The full name of the user associated with the task.
    
- `crm_task_priority_id` (integer): The ID of the task priority.
    
- `crm_task_category_id` (integer): The ID of the task category.
    
- `crm_task_category_name` (string): The name of the task category.
    
- `crm_team_ids` (null): The IDs of the CRM teams associated with the task.
    
- `crm_team_name` (null): The names of the CRM teams associated with the task.
    
- `due_date` (null): The due date of the task.
    
- `reminder_date` (null): The reminder date of the task.
    
- `detail` (string): Additional details about the task.
    
- `crm_checkin_attributes` (null): The check-in attributes of the task.
    
- `next_step` (string): The next step for the task.
    
- `attachment` (null): The attachment related to the task.
    
- `additional_fields` (array): Additional fields for the task. These fields can be obtained from the task template endpoint.
    

#### Response

The response will contain the details of the newly created task.

request.description:
This endpoint allows updating a specific task by sending an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL. The request should include a payload in the raw request body type, containing various parameters such as the task name, associated CRM details, user ID, task status, priority, category, due date, reminder date, details, next step, attachments, and additional fields.

### Request Body

- `name` (string): The updated name of the task.
    
- `crm_person_id` (string): The ID of the associated CRM person.
    
- `crm_deal_id` (string): The ID of the associated CRM deal.
    
- `crm_company_id` (string): The ID of the associated CRM company.
    
- `crm_task_status_id` (integer): The updated status ID of the task.
    
- `user_id` (integer): The ID of the user responsible for the task.
    
- `crm_task_priority_id` (integer): The updated priority ID of the task.
    
- `crm_task_category_id` (integer): The updated category ID of the task.
    
- `due_date` (string): The updated due date of the task.
    
- `reminder_date` (string): The updated reminder date of the task.
    
- `detail` (string): Additional details about the updated task.
    
- `crm_checkin_attributes` (string): Attributes related to CRM check-in.
    
- `next_step` (string): The next step for the updated task.
    
- `attachment` (string): Any attachments related to the updated task.
    
- `additional_fields` (array of objects): Additional fields for the task, including ID, name, and value.  
    The list of the fields can be retrieved by using the get template endpoint.
    

### Response

The response to this request will contain the updated details of the task, confirming the successful update.

### Delete Task

This endpoint is used to delete a specific task by its ID.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: `https://app.qontak.com/api/v3.1/tasks/:id`
    
- Body: No body parameters required for this request.

response.name: Delete Task

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of task categories available.

### Request

The request does not require a request body. It simply makes a GET request to the specified URL.

### Response

The response will include a list of task categories, each containing information such as category ID, name, and description. The response body will be in JSON format.

response.name: Get All Task Categories

request.description:
### Add Task Category

This endpoint allows you to add a new task category.

**Request Body**

- `id` (number, required): The ID of the task category.
    
- `name` (string, required): The name of the task category.
    

**Response**  
The response will contain the details of the newly added task category.

request.description:
# Retrieve Pipeline Details

This endpoint retrieves details of a specific pipeline identified by its unique ID.

## Request

### Request Path Parameters

- `id` (string, required): The unique identifier of the pipeline.
    

## Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `id` (string): The unique identifier of the pipeline.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the pipeline.
    
- `description` (string): Description of the pipeline.
    
- `created_at` (string): The date and time when the pipeline was created.
    
- `updated_at` (string): The date and time when the pipeline was last updated.
    

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "id": "pipeline_id",
    "name": "Pipeline Name",
    "description": "Pipeline Description",
    "created_at": "2022-01-01T12:00:00Z",
    "updated_at": "2022-01-02T15:30:00Z"
}

 ```
